dataIdInfo.idPurp: Unsheltered homeless persons by supervisorial district.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The homeless count is based on a visual point-in-time count of unsheltered homeless persons living outdoors, in vehicles, in makeshift structures or encampments, and in other structures or areas not intended for human habitation. It was conducted over a four-hour time window (8 p.m. to midnight) on the night of January 27, 2011.

The number of unsheltered homeless per 1,000 residents was calculated by dividing the count in each supervisorial district by the number of residents in the district. The percent of unsheltered homeless in each district was calculated by dividing the number of homeless in each district by the total number of unsheltered homeless.

Fields:

SupDist: Supervisorial District

Hmless_cnt: Street homeless count

Hmless_pT: Street homeless per 1,000 residents

Hmless_pct: Percent of total street homeless population

Sources:

2011 San Francisco Homeless Point-In-Time Count & Survey, http://www.sfgov3.org/Modules/ShowDocument.aspx?documentid=787

Consts.useLimit:
There is criticism that the current methodology for counting homeless leaves many individuals uncounted and does not capture the extent of the homeless problem. Homeless advocates have noted that the count misses people living in cars and does not count families living in single room occupancy hotels (SROs). In addition, one advocate noted that "half the hospitals failed to report" the homeless count.

SFDPH Disclaimer: This data is being provided as public information as defined under San Francisco and California public records laws. However, users should not attribute their analysis or interpretation of this data to SFDPH. While the data has been collected and/or produced for the use of SFDPH, the Department cannot guarantee its accuracy or completeness. As all data is associated with methodological assumptions and limitations, the Department recommends that users review methodological documentation associated with the data prior to its analysis, interpretation, or communication.
